channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: The man accused of killing Shinzo Abe, the former prime minister of Japan, said his mother’s huge donations to the Unification Church bankrupted his family. Many others in Japan have similar stories. https://t.co/yN5R2ZmYbv

Google fired one of its engineers, Blake Lemoine, more than a month after he raised ethical concerns about how the company was testing an artificial intelligence chatbot that he believes has achieved consciousness. https://t.co/IHekTFLsh9

Zhifan Dong, a 19-year-old first-year student at the University of Utah, told the school that her ex-boyfriend assaulted her. A month later, she was found dead in a motel room. The university now says it mishandled warning signs leading up to her death. https://t.co/abfbs1KITT

Eighteen months into a criminal probe of election interference by Donald Trump and his allies, a Georgia prosecutor is beginning to show the broad contours of her inquiry. Legal experts say she's building a case that could charge multiple defendants. https://t.co/3s1brJW8l7

The WHO has declared the spread of monkeypox to be a global health emergency. Here's why health experts say monkeypox is unlikely to create a scenario similar to Covid-19, even as more cases are found. https://t.co/5XEfTzpfJw

With international travel returning to prepandemic levels, the U.S. government's Beagle Brigade is sniffing out deadly diseases and pests at border crossings one mango or sausage at a time. https://t.co/h6zQMRyXu4 https://t.co/szkYUTCWDJ
Cannibalism has a time and a place. Some recent books, films and shows suggest that the time is now. Can you stomach it? https://t.co/JzU1QRPYxV

Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the director general of the World Health Organization, declared monkeypox a "public health emergency of international concern" after a panel of advisers could not reach a consensus. https://t.co/IfNFBSbmkv https://t.co/nH0Ew8PRhd

The Biden administration announced another $270 million in military aid for Ukraine, including four more mobile rocket launchers, known as HIMARS. Officials say the weapon has caused severe damage to Russian forces. https://t.co/WKVoamGHpI
Breaking News: The WHO has declared monkeypox to be a global health emergency. With cases already in dozens of countries, many experts had urged faster action. https://t.co/410DFQNDre

For the second time in two years, the WHO has taken the extraordinary step of declaring a global emergency. This time the cause is monkeypox, which has spread in just a few weeks to dozens of countries and infected tens of thousands of people. https://t.co/2x59kkkYbb https://t.co/Sjp273HtJY

Steve Bannon was found guilty of two counts of contempt of Congress on Friday. It is a misdemeanor crime — each count is punishable by a fine of up to $1,000 and a maximum of 12 months in prison. https://t.co/FeDPe2bwyJ https://t.co/BmmHF2A9v6
Breaking News: Explosions rocked the Ukrainian port city of Odesa less than 24 hours after Russia agreed to a deal that would unblock grain shipments by sea. https://t.co/JhZp75YAgL
It can be difficult to sleep when temperatures rise. Here are some tips to help you snooze more soundly. https://t.co/hRGRbSC8n8 https://t.co/8aGizVFIDZ

Lake Mead is the largest reservoir in the U.S. and a critical source of water for 25 million people across seven states. These satellite images show how drastically it has shrunk in two decades. https://t.co/E0SOKeWxkq

Anti-gay rhetoric and calls to roll back LGBTQ protections have grown bolder since Roe v. Wade was overturned. Many Republican officials and candidates across the U.S. have made attacking gay and transgender rights a party norm this midterm season. https://t.co/kbypLEgWI0

The Justice Department has opened a wide-ranging investigation into Houston’s failure to address environmental racism, including the rampant dumping of garbage — and even bodies — in predominantly Black and Latino neighborhoods, officials said. https://t.co/XEJL7sn5Jf

Breaking News: Ukraine and Russia signed a deal to unblock more than 20 million tons of Ukrainian grain, a breakthrough that could ease a global food crisis. The first shipments could begin within weeks, the UN said. https://t.co/3OH3SD8D8p
Sydney McLaughlin of the U.S. broke her own world record — again — to win her first world championship in the 400-meter hurdles. https://t.co/thYDNUgiJY
Wes Moore, an author and former nonprofit executive, won the Democratic primary for governor of Maryland and will face Dan Cox, a Trump loyalist, this fall. https://t.co/IeZ0k78GBz

Rep. Liz Cheney has emerged as the lead narrator in the Jan. 6 hearings, issuing stern warnings against witness tampering and arguing that Donald Trump betrayed the Constitution out of hunger for power. https://t.co/YbQvJK2WkF https://t.co/UdWlbL2UZL
A 29-year police veteran in Rochester, New York, was killed and another officer was wounded on Thursday in what the police described as an ambush. https://t.co/OwTlf3DSoM

A disciplinary board is moving to penalize Jeffrey Clark, the former Justice Department official who worked to undo the results of the 2020 election, including the possibility of disbarment. https://t.co/6y6TmhWXkB
Breaking News: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California signed legislation to provide cash awards to residents who successfully sue makers of guns banned in the state. https://t.co/oA8cHlidDT

A new dictionary — the Oxford Dictionary of African American English — will attempt to capture the rich relationship Black Americans have with the English language. It will collect both definitions and histories of words. https://t.co/CCh6oas73a

The Jan 6. House committee documented Donald Trump's inaction during the 187 minutes after rioters descended on the Capitol, and his private refusal the next day to concede the election and condemn the assault. Watch highlights from Thursday's hearing. https://t.co/fkgXVd7W8I https://t.co/euiEJ7J5A5

The husband of a Colorado woman who has been missing for more than two years pleaded guilty on Thursday to casting her mail-in ballot for Donald Trump during the 2020 election, telling FBI agents, “I figured all these other guys are cheating.” https://t.co/qiMEpeCWcl

Breaking News: Steve Bannon, a former top Trump adviser, was convicted of two counts of contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena from the Jan. 6 panel. The jury deliberated for less than three hours. https://t.co/4Gbl8S4ith

The Jan. 6 House panel on Thursday showed footage of Sen. Josh Hawley fleeing the Capitol as it was being invaded. An image of the Missouri Republican raising his fist in solidarity with Trump supporters earlier on Jan. 6 had become a symbol of the day. https://t.co/7wpk0l3nsr

The Jan. 6 committee played video of Senator Josh Hawley fleeing the mob that stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6, hours after he riled the crowd earlier with a raised fist. The committee room burst into laughter when the footage was played, @hillhulse reports. https://t.co/HXfyM3bLk3 https://t.co/KY1O7Im5Cu

Gov. Gavin Newsom of California is poised to sign legislation that would provide a minimum $10,000 award to residents who successfully sue makers of illegal guns. https://t.co/qJvNMf4gFD https://t.co/MEcv1oGfuY

Jared Kushner testified that Kevin McCarthy, the House Republican leader, called him on Jan. 6 asking for help. During the hearing, the committee highlighted McCarthy’s sharp turnaround about the severity of the Capitol attack. https://t.co/Nx40VjWPFE https://t.co/ey8HYZeg5p

Liz Cheney played an audio clip of Steve Bannon from Oct. 31, 2020, saying that Donald Trump planned to declare victory following the election, no matter what the facts were.
"He's just going to say he's a winner," Bannon can be heard saying. https://t.co/fjUH5PUK6f https://t.co/GpqzKUvbOZ

Donald Trump ignored pleas to call off the mob and refused to say the election was over even a day after the attack. Read our takeaways from Thursday's hearing of the Jan. 6 committee. https://t.co/KNdnPOaNaH

“I don’t want to say the election’s over,” Donald Trump said in outtakes of a video filmed the day after the riot that were played during the Jan. 6 committee hearing. https://t.co/EYamsSnMJk https://t.co/Dqu57fWi8G

Even on Jan. 7, after the Capitol attack, Donald Trump could not admit that he had lost the presidential race, denying his loss in outtakes of a video filmed the day after the riot that were played during the Jan. 6 committee hearing. https://t.co/5nmVrewwnb https://t.co/lmo2rBdIzC

The Jan. 6 committee played video of Senator Josh Hawley fleeing the mob that stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6, hours after he riled the crowd earlier with a raised fist. The committee room burst into laughter when the footage was played, @hillhulse reports. https://t.co/9bErLV70cn https://t.co/y0AoOjRCeQ

During the eighth Jan. 6 committee hearing, Rep. Liz Cheney said "the dam has begun to break," referencing the wall of silence that Trump has always erected around himself, or tried to, with threats or cajoling or flattery to people around him. https://t.co/MPWGvqKVMV https://t.co/sPdb9N9mfS

New testimony in the Jan. 6 committee hearing revealed that members of Mike Pence's secret service detail were calling to say goodbye to their families during the riot. Follow live updates: https://t.co/PjSTMHvOq9

Rep. Bennie Thompson opened Thursday's hearing of the Jan. 6 committee with a call for accountability and by laying out the case that Donald Trump chose not to act on the day of the riot. Follow live updates: https://t.co/64ylC7aWiC https://t.co/f7OSWPotNx

Rep. Liz Cheney has emerged as the lead narrator in the Jan. 6 hearings, issuing stern warnings against witness tampering and arguing that Donald Trump betrayed the Constitution out of hunger for power. https://t.co/cjNC4X7uWn https://t.co/dTvlmfmqZR

North America’s monarch butterfly has been classified as endangered by the International Union for Conservation of Nature, the world’s most comprehensive scientific authority on the status of species. The decision follows decades of falling populations. https://t.co/AYvmcDdhvk https://t.co/ec8gLmn1n8
Jonathon Heyward is the first person of color to be the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra’s music director in its 106-year history. https://t.co/WnDA6aAaoB https://t.co/Z2k8qlRMHs

Amazon said it had reached a $3.9 billion deal to acquire One Medical, a network of primary care clinics. The move is a big step in its plans to become a major player in health care. https://t.co/X4wdQkjX1p

Breaking News: President Biden tested positive for the coronavirus and is "experiencing very mild symptoms," the White House said. He is fully vaccinated and twice boosted. https://t.co/Lesn1DjELu https://t.co/e0010PkLUi

President Biden tested positive on Thursday for the coronavirus. He will isolate at the White House and "continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time," press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said. https://t.co/wiNhIjI6p4

Ukraine has discovered new hacking techniques that Russia is using and has continued to block efforts to penetrate its computer networks since Moscow invaded the country, the U.S. Cyber Command said Wednesday. https://t.co/b7ftZpOCqb

Ukraine’s first lady, Olena Zelenska, addressed the U.S. Congress on Wednesday, asking for more weapons to defend against what she called the "Russian hunger games" killing children and ripping apart families. "Russia is destroying our people," she said. https://t.co/HOJ8Q8i6r2 https://t.co/eiY2YmTDRC

Donald Trump called a top Republican in the State Legislature in Wisconsin in recent days to lobby for a measure that would overturn his 2020 loss in the state to President Biden. https://t.co/9ePUUDM0If

A Pennsylvania man was arrested on Sunday in connection with the 1975 murder of a 19-year-old woman after the authorities identified him through a DNA sample obtained from a coffee cup at the Philadelphia International Airport. https://t.co/NaWVD9hYsS
